text.0: drink soma mighty one for which when lauded thou breakest through the cattlestall o indra.
text.1: thou who o bold one armed with thunder smotest vṛtra with might and every hostile being.
text.2: drink it thou god who art impetuous victor lord of our hymns with beauteousjaws the hero.
text.3: render of kinestalls carborne thunderwielding so pierce thy way to wondrous strength o indra.
text.4: drink as of old and let the draught delight thee hear thou our prayer and let our songs exalt thee.
text.5: make the sun visible make food abundant slaughter the foes pierce through and free the cattle.
text.6: these gladdening drops o indra selfsustainer quaffed shall augment thee in thy mighty splendour.
text.7: yea let the cheering drops delight thee greatly great perfect strong powerful allsubduing.
text.8: gladdened whereby bursting the firm enclosures thou gavest splendour to the sun and morning.
text.9: the mighty rock that compassed in the cattle neer moved thou shookest from its seat o indra.
text.10: thou with thy wisdom power and works of wonder hast stored the ripe milk in the raw cows udders.
text.11: unbarred the firm doors for the kine of morning and with the aṅgirases set free the cattle.
text.12: thou hast spread out wide earth a mighty marvel and high thyself propped lofty heaven o indra.
text.13: both worlds whose sons are gods thou hast supported young mothers from old time ofholy order.
text.14: yea indra all the deities installed thee their one strong champion in the van for battle.
text.15: what time the godless was the gods assailant indra they chose to win the light of heaven.
text.16: yea een that heaven itself of old bent backward before thy bolt in terror of its anger.
text.17: when indra life of every living creature smote down within his lair the assailing dragon.
text.18: yea strong one tvaṣṭar turned for thee the mighty the bolt with thousand spikes and hundred edges.
text.19: eager and prompt at will wherewith thou crushedst the boasting dragon o impetuous hero.
text.20: he dressed a hundred buffaloes o indra for thee whom all accordant maruts strengthen.
text.21: he pūṣan viṣṇu poured forth three great vessels to him the juice that cheers that slaughters vṛtra.
text.22: thou settest free the rushing wave of waters the floods great swell encompassed and obstructed.
text.23: along steep slopes their course thou tumedst indra directed downward speeding to the ocean.
text.24: so may our new prayer bring thee to protect us thee wellarmed hero with thy bolt of thunder.
text.25: indra who made these worlds the strong the ty who never groweth old the victorygiver.
text.26: so indra form us brilliant holy singers for strength for glory and for food and riches.
text.27: give bharadvāja hero patrons indra indra be ours upon the day of trial.
text.28: with this may we obtain strength godappointed and brave sons gladden us through a hundred winters.
